sub_title: Associate Professor at TU/e, Teacher of the year 2022 (Netherlands) in higher education
summary:
I am an experimental physicist, very hands on due to my engineering background, my expertise is in the field of spintronics and magnetism. 

I specialise in the growth of (magnetic) thin films used for future data storage, logic and memory applications where we investigate new fundamental and applied physical phenomena and build on their understanding.

I love to teach the tricks of the trade to our students and help them become independent, critical, and enthousiastic researchers or engineers of the future.

profile_positions.description: Postdoctoral position investigating the delicate interplay between competing interactions in ultrathin magnets. Position funded by a personal grant from The Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO).
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow (NWO-VENI grant)

profile_positions.description: Post-doctoral researcher in the thin film magnetism group with Russell Cowburn at the Cavendish laboratory in Cambridge, UK
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow (NWO-Rubicon grant)

profile_positions.description: PhD position exploring current induced domain wall motion in perpendicularly magnetized thin films. Received my doctorate degree on the 27th of January 2011.
profile_positions.title: PhD - Domain wall dynamics in perpendicularly magnetized devices

profile_positions.description: Research Position at the Physics of Nanostructures group at the faculty of applied physics at the TU/e, on MgO, a tunnel barrier material for magnetic tunnel junctions with high potential. Realisation and implementation in junctions.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis: MgO based Magnetic Tunnel Junctions

profile_positions.description: Engineering/Simulating the cool-down characteristics of the new Large Hadron Collider under construction. In a tight team we were responsible for the engineering of the cryogenics of the worlds biggest machine.
profile_positions.title: Bachelors Thesis: Cryogenics engineer

company.name: CESTM, State University New York in Albany

profile_positions.company: CESTM, State University New York in Albany
profile_positions.description: Testing and researching the possibilities with newly developed MEMS based optical components for optical interconnects, like tuneable gratings and micro mirrors.
profile_positions.title: Internship: MEMS based optical interconnects

profile_positions.description: Operator job during school weeks, in the holidays i worked with the packaging departement on the testing and development of the Wavelength locking laser. I wrote several LabView test programs during my stay here.
profile_positions.title: Operator
